peppermining.kpi.average_events_per_case module

class peppermining.kpi.average_events_per_case.AverageEventsPerCase(pepper_data)[source]

Bases: PepperKpi

KPI - Average events per case.

get_kpi()[source]

Return summary of KPI.

Example

>>> pm = PepperMining()
>>> pm.read_event_log_csv("/tests/data/eventlog-example.csv", separator=';', format_date='%d/%m/%Y %H:%M')
>>> pm.read_cases_csv("/tests/data/case-example.csv", separator=';')
>>> f1 = CaseFilter(pm, [1, 5, 7, 8])
>>> kp1 = AverageEventsPerCase(pm)
>>> kp1.get_kpi()
>>> kp2 = AverageEventsPerCase(f1)
>>> kp2.get_kpi()
get_kpi() → DataFrame[source]

Return summary of KPI.

Returns:

DataFrame with the summary data.

Return type:

DataFrame

peppermining.kpi.pepper_kpi module

class peppermining.kpi.pepper_kpi.PepperKpi(pepper_data)[source]

Bases: object

The base class should be used to create the statistics and KPI (Key Performance Indicator) in Pepper Mining.

In Pepper Mining, it is possible to calculate different statistics and KPI on top of event logs and cases. The PepperKpi declares common operations for the KPIs of Pepper Mining. Each implementation of PepperKpi it can has several specific methods. The Pepper Mining has various kpis implemented, such: (1) NumberOfEvents: Number of events per: Summary, Cases, Activities, Date (day, month, year), and Variant. (2) NumberOfActivities: Number of activities per: Summary, Cases, and Variant. (3) NumberOfCases: Number of cases per: Summary, Activities, Date (day, month, year), and Variant. (4) AverageEventsPerCase: Average events per case. Disponible in the Summary. (5) ThroughputTime: Throughput time per: Summary, Cases, Activities, Event Log, and Variant. (6) Rework: Rework per: Summary, Cases, and Activities.

_component

PepperMining or PepperFilter object.

_kpi_id

KPI identifier.

Type:

str

_kpi_name

KPI name.

Type:

str

get_kpi()[source]

Return summary of KPI.

get_kpi_event_log()[source]

Return KPI value per event log.

get_kpi_cases()[source]

Return KPI value per case.

get_kpi_variants()[source]

Return KPI value per variant.

get_kpi_activities()[source]

Return KPI value per activity.

Return standard DataFrame of summary.

peppermining.kpi.rework module

class peppermining.kpi.rework.Rework(pepper_data)[source]

Bases: PepperKpi

KPI - Rework.

The rework statistic can be useful to identify the cases in which many events are repetitions of activities that have already been performed.

get_kpi()[source]

Return summary of KPI.

get_kpi_cases()[source]

Return KPI value per case.

get_kpi_activities()[source]

Return KPI value per activity.

Example

>>> pm = PepperMining()
>>> pm.read_event_log_csv("/tests/data/eventlog-example.csv", separator=';', format_date='%d/%m/%Y %H:%M')
>>> pm.read_cases_csv("/tests/data/case-example.csv", separator=';')
>>> f1 = CaseFilter(pm, [1, 5, 7, 8])
>>> kp1 = Rework(pm)
>>> kp1.get_kpi()
>>> kp2 = Rework(f1)
>>> kp2.get_kpi()
get_kpi() → DataFrame[source]

Return summary of KPI.

Calculates the total number of activities that were repeated.

Returns:

DataFrame with the summary data.

Return type:

DataFrame

get_kpi_activities() → DataFrame[source]

Compute KPI Rework per Activity

The rework statistic permits to identify the activities which have been repeated during the same process execution. This shows the underlying inefficiencies in the process.

Returns:

DataFrame with the activities and KPI data.

Return type:

DataFrame

get_kpi_cases() → DataFrame[source]

Return KPI Rework per case.

We define as rework at the case level the number of events of a case having an activity which has appeared previously in the case.

Returns:

DataFrame with the cases and and KPI data.

Return type:

DataFrame

peppermining.kpi.throughput_time module

class peppermining.kpi.throughput_time.ThroughputTime(pepper_data)[source]

Bases: PepperKpi

KPI - Throughput time.

Throughput time is the actual time an activity takes to be done. This includes the entire duration from start to end of the activity, which in many cases means the time a factory needs to convert raw materials into finished goods. Given an event log, it is possible to retrieve the list of all the durations of the cases (expressed in seconds).

get_kpi()[source]

Return summary of KPI.

get_kpi_event_log()[source]

Return KPI value per event log.

get_kpi_cases()[source]

Return KPI value per case.

get_kpi_variants()[source]

Return KPI value per variant.

get_kpi_activities()[source]

Return KPI value per activity.

get_kpi_process_flow()[source]

Return the Throughput Time the a activity is followed by another specified activity.

Example

>>> pm = PepperMining()
>>> pm.read_event_log_csv("/tests/data/eventlog-example.csv", separator=';', format_date='%d/%m/%Y %H:%M')
>>> pm.read_cases_csv("/tests/data/case-example.csv", separator=';')
>>> f1 = CaseFilter(pm, [1, 5, 7, 8])
>>> kp1 = ThroughputTime(pm)
>>> kp1.get_kpi()
>>> kp2 = ThroughputTime(f1)
>>> kp2.get_kpi()
